member.name: T:CSMSL.Chemistry.ChemicalFormula
member.summary: A chemical / molecule consisting of multiple atoms. This class is mutable

member.name: F:CSMSL.Chemistry.ChemicalFormula.FormulaRegex
member.summary: A regular expression for matching chemical formulas such as: C2C{13}3H5NO5 \s* (at end as well) allows for optional spacing among the elements, i.e. C2 C{13}3 H5 N O5 The first group is the only non-optional group and that handles the chemical symbol: H, He, etc.. The second group is optional, which handles alternative isotopes of elements: C{13} means carbon-13, while C is the common carbon-12 The third group is optional and indicates if we are adding or subtracting the elements form the formula, C-2C{13}5 would mean first subtract 2 carbon-12 and then add 5 carbon-13 The fourth group is optional and represents the number of isotopes to add, if not present it assumes 1: H2O means 2 Hydrogen and 1 Oxygen Modified from: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4116786/parsing-a-chemical-formula-from-a-string-in-c

member.name: F:CSMSL.Chemistry.ChemicalFormula.ValidateFormulaRegex
member.summary: A wrapper for the formula regex that validates if a string is in the correct chemical formula format or not

member.name: F:CSMSL.Chemistry.ChemicalFormula.InternChemicalFormulaStrings
member.summary: Determines if the chemical formula hill notation string is stored or calculated each time it is called. True means the notation is stored as a string in the chemical formula (quicker, but more memory) False means the notation is not stored as a string in the chemical formula (slower, no used memory) Changing this value will not automatically delete the interned notations of formulas. The default value is true.

member.name: T:CSMSL.Chemistry.IsotopicDistribution
member.summary: Calculates the isotopic distributions of molecules
member.remarks:
C# version by Derek Bailey 2014
This is a port of software written in C++ and detailed in the following publication:
Molecular Isotopic Distribution Analysis (MIDAs) with Adjustable Mass Accuracy. Gelio Alves, Aleksy Y. Ogurtsov, and Yi-Kuo Yu J. Am. Soc. Mass Spectrom. (2014) 25:57-70 DOI: 10.1007/s13361-013-0733-7
Please cite that publication if using these algorithms in your own publications.

member.name: F:CSMSL.IO.MSDataFile`1.CacheScans
member.summary: Defines if MS scans should be cached for quicker retrieval. Cached scans are held in an internal array and don't get cleared until the file is disposed or the ClearCacheScans() method is called. Of course, if you store the scans somewhere else, they will persist. The default value is True.

member.summary: Creates a range from the minimum to maximum values

The maximum value of the range

member.summary: Creates a range from another double range. This is the clone constructor.
member.param: The other range to copy

member.name: M:CSMSL.DoubleRange.#ctor(System.Double,CSMSL.Tolerance)
member.summary:
Creates a range around some mean value with a specified tolerance.
i.e. 10 ppm at 500 would give you 499.9975 - 500.0025 which has a width of 0.005. Converting back to ppm (1e6) *0.005 / 500 = 10 ppm.
The difference from the mean value to an boundary is exactly half the tolerance you specified
member.param: The mean value for the range
The tolerance range

member.name: P:CSMSL.DoubleRange.Mean
member.summary: The mean value of this range: (Max + Min) / 2

member.name: P:CSMSL.DoubleRange.Width
member.summary: The width of this range: (Max - Min)

member.name: M:CSMSL.DoubleRange.ToPPM
member.summary: Calculates the ppm tolerance value for this range: 1e6 * Width / Mean;
member.returns: The ppm

member.name: M:CSMSL.DoubleRange.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this range at the given numerical format
member.param: The format to display the double values
